Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2014 10:47PM soblessedx2 wrote: Hi everyone,  I Just wanted to update on biopsy result. It came back benign as a fibroadenoma. Thank you for your support.  May God bless all of you on your journeys. I really considered what life could be like as a mom with small kids having cancer. You ladies and gentlemen are amazing. I have learned so much  from you and will and will/have begun sharing with friends so they can be aware.  Muneera
Posts.Title: MRI Led Breast Biopsy done today soblessedx2 angelaisscared

Posts.Content: soblessedx2 wrote: Hi Everyone, I hope all of you are doing ok. I have been shadowing the boards for a while now and learning so much. The strength and courage I have found amongst the members here has been absolutely amazing :) God bless all of you. My journey began with pain shooting in my right breast late last year. I was sent for my first mamo, which I went ahead and paid extra for a digital one due to having dense breasts. I had a feeling I would be called back from the waiting room for more shots and then again for ultrasound. The tech and then the radiologist tried hard but could not see the small node they saw on the mamo. (In the other breast!) MRI was recommended and that was done in January. They recommended at the time a 6 month follow up MRI in June. That was done and this time BIRADS was 4 and there were kinetic changes, but size had not changed. Being that it was so hard to see, a MRI led biopsy was recommended and that is what was done today. I have just begun to have stinging pain in the breast; started about 3 days ago at work in a meeting. Unfortunately, there is a holiday and a weekend in between me and the results :p I will try to stay as calm as possible. At first I was concerned when the Radiologist kept coming back for more samples. Makes me think it was concerned and wanted to get as much tissue for testing as possible. He took like 9 samples. But I am grateful now though because I had really just wanted it removed and not just biopsied being that it is only a centimeter. The thought of worrying about what was left of it possibly changing year after year was getting to me. I believe he was really trying to just get it all out and looking at the mamo they took right after to verify clip placement, that is what It looks like He did. There is no node to even be seen anymore just black holes or air space on the mamo. The positioning for 45 min hurt my arms and back terribly because I could not move and going in and out of the MRI machine repeatedly was not cool either... Pain was minimal and staff was awesome they tried to make me as comfortable as possible and were even massaging my back. Wish all health care personnel were so kind. Being a Nurse myself and always wanting to comfort others, it meant a lot. Muneera :) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: MRI Led Breast Biopsy done today soblessedx2 angelaisscared

Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2014 02:29AM soblessedx2 wrote: Thank you Lintrollerderby I actually took a 1/4 of xanax to help get through the procedure yesterday. I have a few More pills and will definitely use them as needed. I can only tolerate a 1/4 without getting too sedated. This will be the longest wait ever. My Granny is a survivor and it is nice to be able to talk to her. My Mom of course is really worried but channeling that in prayer which I greatly need.  I have thought a lot about it and if needed plan to fight hard for my kids and family. They are only 4 and 5 and we 've a long way to go.  Muneera
